name: Nights in White Satin Quiz | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Who sings the song with these lyrics?

"I don't wanna go to bed mad at you, and I don't want you to go to bed mad at me."
questions.explanation:
Ne-Yo.

	"Mad" was released in 2008 on Ne-Yo's album "Year of the Gentleman".  Ne-Yo's birth name was Shaffer Chimere Oghenekome Smith.  His other hit songs include "Closer", "Because of You", and "Beautiful Monster".

questions.text:
"Come and lay your head on this big brass bed."

This song, by Josh Gracin, is called "Brass Bed", but can also go by another name.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Stay With Me.

	"Stay With Me (Brass Bed)" reached 5th place on the US Billboard Country Songs list, the third single of Josh Gracin's to do so.  "Stay With Me (Brass Bed)" was released in 2005 on Gracin's self-titled album.  Josh Gracin got his start on the second season of "American Idol", where he placed fourth.

questions.text:
"Come to bed.  Let's just lay down.  There's just one way we're gonna work this out."

"Come to Bed" was sung by which of these country artists?
questions.explanation:
Gretchen Wilson.

	"Come to Bed" was on Gretchen Wilson's third album entitled "One of the Boys".  It was released in 2007, and debuted at #1 on the Country album chart, and fifth on the Top 200.

questions.text: Young Money, a group composed of many rappers from Young Money Entertainment, sang a song named after the fictional city where the Flintstones lived.  What is the title of the song, and also the city of "Flintstones" fame?
questions.explanation:
Bedrock.

	"BedRock" was sung by Young Money members Lil Wayne, Gudda Gudda, Nicki Minaj, Drake, Tyga, and Jae Millz, and featured Lloyd.  It was released in late 2009 on the album "We Are Young Money".

questions.text:
"Whose Bed Have Your Boots Been Under?"

This question was asked in 1995 by which country artist?
questions.explanation:
Shania Twain.

	Canadian country artist Shania Twain released "Whose Bed Have Your Boots Been Under?" in 1995.  It was the first single off her album "The Woman in Me".

questions.text:
"Find another place to feed your greed while I find a place to rest."

Linkin Park sing these lyrics, but they come from which song?
questions.explanation:
A Place For My Head.

	"A Place For My Head", as well as the other three titles, were all released on Linkin Park's album "Hybrid Theory" in 2001.  It had sold 24,000,000 copies worldwide, making it the second most best-selling album of the decade, second only to the Beatles' album "1".  This also placed it as the 26th most sold album of all time.

questions.text:
"I dream of your arms around me as I tuck the kids in bed."

"And I sleep alone.  I cry alone."

These are both lyrics from the song "Come Home Soon", which is sung by which country music band?
questions.explanation:
SHeDAISY.

	SHeDAISY is derived from a Navajo word meaning "my little sister", as the three in the group are all sisters.  "Come Home Soon" was released on their 2004 album "Sweet Right Here".  The title of the album comes from lyrics found in one of their singles from the album, "Passenger Seat".

questions.text:
Who needs a bed to sleep?  In a Snow Patrol music video, the man lays down wherever he happens to be, whether it be a street, an airport, or whatever.  In the end, though, he lays in a bed.  But which Snow Patrol song do these lyrics come from?

"If I lay here.  If I just lay here.  Would you lie with me and just forget the world."
questions.explanation:
Chasing Cars.

	All four titles were released in Snow Patrol's 2006 album "Eyes Open".  The song became very popular in the UK, but did not gain popularity in the US until it was featured on the season two finale of "Grey's Anatomy".

questions.text:
"Got to the hallway, well on my way, to my lovin' bed.  I almost didn't notice all the roses, and the note that said."

These lyrics come from Taylor Swift, but which chart topping song do they belong?
questions.explanation:
Our Song.

	"Our Song" was released in 2006 from Taylor Swift's self-titled album, when Swift was but 16 years old.  The song is about a girlfriend, upset that her and her boyfriend don't have "a song", and the boyfriend comforts her saying that "Our song is a slamming screen door, sneaking out late tapping on your window..."

questions.text:
"When everybody else is getting out of bed, I'm usually getting in it."

"If It's Love" was released by which band?
questions.explanation:
Train.

	"If It's Love" was released on Train's fifth album, "Save Me, San Francisco", in 2010.  The song became their fourth number one single, tying the band with Daughtry and Matchbox Twenty for second most chart-topping singles on Billboard's Hot Adult Top 40 chart, with Nickelback in first place.
